subject: Photography
title: Photojournalism Ethics
description: A fast breakdown of Photojournalism Ethics for builders.

hook.text: Should a photojournalist help a suffering person or keep shooting? The ethical dilemma is as old as the profession.

buildup.text: Photojournalists are bound by codes: don't stage, don't alter, don't mislead. Truth is the product.

discovery.text: Manipulation â€” cloning, compositing, staging â€” violates trust. Several careers have ended over altered images.

twist.text: Kevin Carter won a Pulitzer for a photo of a starving child. He was attacked for not helping. He died by suicide.

climax.text: Photojournalism's ethics are heavy. The camera demands witness. Humanity demands intervention. Both are real.

punchline.text: The hardest choice: help the person or tell their story.

quiz.question: What is strictly prohibited in ethical photojournalism?
options: Staging, altering, or manipulating images to mislead
